intro: Drejerella comosa, commonly known as the fuzzy leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance, while its flowers are small and clustered in a composite head. Drejerella comosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and drought tolerance.
